original_title: Sri Lanka T-bill auction yields slightly up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields rose across maturities at Wednesday’s auction with all offered bills being sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 73.5 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.74 percent, up 11 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 60 billion rupees.
19 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 25.27 percent, up 30 basis points from a week earlier after offering 25 billion rupees.
21.9 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 23.00 percent, up 4 basis points from a week earlier after offering 35 billion. (Colombo/ April26/2023)
